alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; Inland Bay; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Inland Wakulla; Leon; Liberty; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 19 at 10:58AM EDT until July 19 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT /7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heat index values up to 108 expected. * WHERE...Washington, Inland Bay, Calhoun, Inland Gulf, Inland Franklin, Leon, Liberty, Inland Wakulla, Coastal Bay and Coastal Gulf Counties. * WHEN...Until 8 PM EDT /7 PM CDT/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of forecast high temperatures in the 90s with high humidity will make for dangerous heat conditions today when feels-like temperatures peak close to or just over 108 degrees.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; Inland Bay; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Inland Wakulla; Leon; Liberty; Washington
